pullRequest.body:
Every element in the closure of such a set `s` can be written as a finite sup of elements of the form `a \ b` with `a`, `b` in `s`.

---

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

### PR summary [cccb6fe160](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20251/commits/cccb6fe1600cb144c6e8718c2d548c0ab53e34c6)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ closure_sdiff_sup_induction`
`+ mem_closure_iff_sup_sdiff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

> Can we also have the dual versions using `himp`?

Is it useful? `closure_bot_sup_induction` didn't have a `top_inf` counterpart. Maybe you can try to use the dual Boolean algebra to prove it?

maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Thank you for sorting this out!
Can we also have the dual versions using `himp`?

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
theorem mem_closure_iff_sup_sdiff (lattice : LatticeClosed s)
```
There is `latticeClosure` but `LatticeClosed` does not appear to exist.
Oh uh, so it does not ðŸ™ˆ

```suggestion
    (bot_mem : âŠ¥ âˆˆ s) (top_mem : âŠ¤ âˆˆ s) {a : Î±} :
```
Can you first provide the DNF induction principle we talked about on Zulip?

I added [an induction principle](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20251/files#diff-a46200dbd79beae0d9c1e6367c85e13cdf48877d9af2f698bd16fe33e4004541R388-R398) that is hopefully close to what you want. I tried to prove it directly, but I don't think the last chunk of the proof (about taking complements) works without  writing the involved element explicitly as a Finset.sup of the given form.

I'm not sure about the exact form of the induction principle you want in [the Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/116395-maths/topic/Disjunction.20Normal.20Form.20for.20a.20generated.20boolean.20subalgebra/near/489911341); do you want to take the basis to consist of (retrocompact?) affine opens? But you may need to take infinite unions to get all retrocompact opens, right?

Also, I think
```
{U | IsOpen U âˆ§ âˆ€ â¦ƒUâ¦„, IsCompact U â†’ IsOpen U â†’ IsCompact (s âˆ© U)})
```
in the thread should be
```
{U | IsOpen U âˆ§ âˆ€ â¦ƒsâ¦„, IsCompact s â†’ IsOpen s â†’ IsCompact (s âˆ© U)})
```

> But you may need to take infinite unions to get all retrocompact opens, right?

I should not, because I am assuming the space is compact.

> Also, I think [...] in the thread should be [...]

Well spotted!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(BooleanSubalgebra): closure of supClosed+infClosed set containing bot+top
